Name: ABSOLUTE [91]
Input Format: HAPSEG output, sample level variance, precomputed models of cancer types, sigma values
Output Format: Plot showing the Purity/Ploidy, R data file
Notes: Comes bundles with HAPSEG;

Name: Align-GVGD [92]
Notes: Estimates SNP risk;

Name: ANNOVAR [93]
Input Format: VCF4, Complete Genomics, GFF3-SOLiD, CSV in Annovar format;
Output Format: Gene-based annotation; Region-based annotations; Filter-based annotation. For all categories
Notes: Integrated tool providing gene annotation, db ids and various scores;

Name: AnnTools [94]
Notes: Provides a set of helper tools for custom annotation;

Name: Auto-mute [95]
Notes: The tool performs stability and disease potential predictions.

Name: CHASM and SNVBox [97]
Output Format: CSV including CHASM score, p-value, and FDR
Notes: Predicts the functional significance of somatic missense mutations observed in the genomes of cancer cells and features prioritization of mutations;

Name: CUPSAT [98]
Notes: Performs protein stability prediction;

Name: dbNSFP [99]
Notes: Integrated SNP database; provides a simple JAVA CLI tool for searching;

Name: VEP (Ensembl - Variant Effect Predictor) [100]
Input Format: CSV, VCF, Pileup, HGVS, Variant Identifiers

Name: ESEfinder [101]
Notes: Analyzes sequences for the presence of ESE motifs;

Name: ESRSearch [102]
Notes: Finds ESR sequences;

Name: FANS [103]
Input Format: FASTA format; or variation information via web interface
Notes: Prioritized variations based on risk levels; divided into: Genome View, Gene View, Transcript View, Variation View;

Name: FastSNP [104]
Notes: Outputs prioritized list of SNPs with risk assessment;

Name: FESD [105]
Notes: Output includes regions: promoter, CpG, islands, translation start, splice site, translation stop, poly(A) signal, transcript;

Name: FOLD-X [106]
Notes: It performs protein stability analysis.

Name: F-SNP [107]
Input Format: SNP ID; disease; gene; chromosomal region
Notes: The software integrates information obtained from 16 bioinformatics tools and databases about the functional effects of SNPs.

Name: GERP++ [108]
Notes: It produces evolutionary conservation scores.

Name: GSITIC [109]
Input Format: Segmentation File, Markers File, FASTA, (Array List File, CNV File)
Output Format: Lesions, Amplification Genes, Deletion Genes, Gistic Scores, Plots
Notes: Identifies regions of the genome that are significantly amplified or deleted across a set of samples;

Name: HOPE [110]
Output Format: Web report on structural differences between wild type and mutations
Notes: The web-based tool offers a simple web interface for entering protein sequence and amino acid mutation.

Name: Human Splicing Finder (HSF) [111]
Input Format:
Ensembl / RefSeq ID,
plain text sequences

Name: I-Mutant2.0 [112]
Input Format: One letter residue code, sequence residue number
Notes: The tool is based on support vector machines.

Name: LS-SNP [113]
Input Format: SwissProt ID, dbSNP ID, Kegg Pathway ID, HUGO Gene ID
Notes: The tool offers prediction of disease association and confidence of prediction and is based on support vector machines (SVM).

Name: MutaGeneSys [116]
Notes: The query Interface is not working.

Name: MutationAssessor [117]
Input Format: CSV in MutationAssessor format, Uniprot ID, Refseq ID

Name: MutationTaster [118]
Input Format: ORF, cDNA sequence, genomic sequence, alteration

Name: MutPred [119]
Input Format: FASTA sequence, CSV file of mutations
Notes: Calculates the impact of mutation on different protein properties; is based on SIFT and offers precomputed dbSNP results;

Name: MutSig [120]
Input Format: List of mutations, regions to investigate
Notes: Still in beta testing â€“ available upon request

Name: nsSNPAnalyzer [122]
Notes: The tool outputs various SNP features and predicts the phenotypic class.

Name: Oncotator [123]
Notes: Annotations with data relevant to cancer researcher; collects Genomic Annotations, Protein Annotations, Cancer Annotations

Name: PANTHER [124]
Notes: Uses subPSEC score;

Name: Parepro [125]
Notes: It is based on support vector machines (SVM).

Name: PESX [126]
Notes: Finds ESE sequences;

Name: pfSNP [127]
Input Format: SNP ID; chromosome region; Gene ID;

Name: PHAST [128]
Notes: Phylogenetic analysis toolbox, including phastCons and phyloP;

Name: PhD-SNP [129]
Input Format: One letter residue code, Swiss-Prot protein code, Sequence file

Name: PMUT [130]
Notes: Offers different prediction modes and is able to output detailed mutation analysis reports;

Name: PolyMAPr [132]
Notes: No longer available;

Name: PupaSNP Finder [134]
Input Format: dbSNP ID, Gene/Transcript ID; PED format

Name: SAPRED [137]
Notes: The website is offline.

Name: SeattleSeq Annotation [140]
Input Format: Maq, GFFm CASAVA, VCF, GATK bed

Name: SeqProfCod [142]
Notes: Not available online;

Name: SVA (Sequence Variant Analyser) [143]
Input Format: VCF of variants, project file (for command line version)

Name: SIFT [144]
Input Format: Multiple proteins, dbSNP ID, NCBI GI number, protein sequence, protein sequence alignment, Pileup, VCF4, maq, soap, gff3, casava, cg

Name: SNAP [147]
Notes: This tool offers a user friendly web interface.

Name: SNP@Domain [149]
Notes: Not available anymore;

Name: SNPdbe [150]
Notes: The protein function is predicted using SNAP and SIFT and entries are augmented with experimental information from public databases.

Name: SNPeffect 4.0 [151]

Name: SNPnexus [153]
Notes: Outputs CNV, INDELs, inversions;

Name: SNPselector [158]

Name: SPOT [160]
Notes: Outputs various DB ids and scores;

Name: TAMAL [162]
